conclusion: Points A, B, and C form an equilateral triangle with center O.
Charges +q are placed at A and B.
Net electric field at O due to charges at A and B is E.
O is equidistant from A, B, and C with distance d/√3.
Electric field due to each charge +q at O is 3kq/d².
Resultant electric field at O is 3√3kq/d².
An equal magnitude but opposite sign charge -q is placed at C.
Electric field at O due to charge -q at C is 3kq/d².
Net electric field at O is 3kq/d²(√3 - 1).
Potential due to each charge +q at O is k√3q/d.
Total potential due to A and B at O is 2√3kq/d.
Potential due to -q at O is -k√3q/d.
Net potential at O is k√3q/d.
Final electric field strength at O is 3kq/d²(√3 - 1).
Final electric potential at O is k√3q/d.
